briefdescription.para: Unique identifier for this GameObject.

detaileddescription.para: Generated during construction and remains constant for the lifetime of the object. Used for lookups in GameWorld and command targeting.

briefdescription.para: Type-indexed storage for components attached to this GameObject.

detaileddescription.para: Components are stored at indices corresponding to their `ComponentTypeId::value()`. The vector is resized dynamically when component types with higher IDs are added. Slots for component types not attached to this GameObject contain nullptr.
This storage model provides O(1) access and modification at the cost of potential sparse memory usage (nullptr entries for unused component type IDs).

simplesect.para: The vector may contain nullptr entries. Use `components()` for iteration over non-null components, which returns a cached, filtered view.

briefdescription.para: Active state flag for this GameObject.

detaileddescription.para: Inactive GameObjects are skipped during iteration and updates. When the state changes, onActivate() or onDeactivate() is called on all components.

briefdescription.para: Flag indicating whether the component cache needs to be rebuilt.

detaileddescription.para: Set to true when components are added or removed. The cache is lazily rebuilt on the next call to `components()`.

briefdescription.para: Cached view of non-null component pointers for mutable access.

detaileddescription.para: Rebuilt from `components_` when `needsUpdate_` is true. Provides filtered access excluding nullptr entries.

briefdescription.para: Cached view of non-null component pointers for const access.

detaileddescription.para: Rebuilt from `components_` when `needsUpdate_` is true. Provides filtered access excluding nullptr entries.

briefdescription.para: Invalidates the component cache, forcing a rebuild on next access.

detaileddescription.para: Called automatically when components are added or removed.

briefdescription.para: Rebuilds the component cache if invalidated.

detaileddescription.para: Iterates through `components_` and populates `componentView_` and `componentConstView_` with non-null entries. This operation is O(n) where n is the size of the components vector.

briefdescription.para: Constructs a new GameObject with a unique Guid.

detaileddescription.para: The Guid is automatically generated and remains constant for the lifetime of this object.

briefdescription.para: Constructs a new GameObject with a specified active state.

parameterdescription.para: Initial active state. If false, the object starts inactive.

briefdescription.para: Virtual destructor for proper polymorphic cleanup.
Adds a new component of type T to the GameObject.

detaileddescription.para: The component is created in-place, stored at the index corresponding to its `ComponentTypeId`, and attached to this GameObject (`onAttach()` is called). If the type ID exceeds the current vector capacity, the vector is resized.
**Complexity:** O(1) amortized. Resize operations are O(n) but occur infrequently.

parameterdescription.para: The type of component to add. Must derive from Component.
Argument types for the component's constructor.
Arguments forwarded to the component's constructor.

simplesect.para: Reference to the newly created component.
No component of type T is already attached (asserts in debug mode).
The component is stored directly at `components_[ComponentTypeId::id<T>().value()]`.

briefdescription.para: Adds a pre-constructed component if no component of the same type exists.

detaileddescription.para: If a component with the same `ComponentTypeId` already exists, returns the existing component without taking ownership of the passed pointer. Otherwise, stores the component at its type-indexed position and takes ownership.
**Complexity:** O(1) amortized. May trigger resize if type ID exceeds capacity.

parameterdescription.para: Unique pointer to the component to add. Ownership is transferred only if no component of the same type exists.

simplesect.para: Pointer to the existing or newly added component, or nullptr if the input was nullptr.
Uses `component->typeId()` for runtime type identification.

briefdescription.para: Retrieves an existing component of type T, or creates and adds it if not present.

detaileddescription.para: Convenience method that combines `get<T>()` and `add<T>()`. If the component already exists, the constructor arguments are ignored.
**Complexity:** O(1) amortized.

parameterdescription.para: The type of component to retrieve or add. Must derive from Component.
Argument types for the component's constructor.
Arguments forwarded to the component's constructor if creation is needed.

simplesect.para: Reference to the existing or newly created component.

briefdescription.para: Retrieves a component of type T.

detaileddescription.para: Performs a direct array access using the component's type ID. If the type ID is out of bounds or the slot is nullptr, returns nullptr.
**Complexity:** O(1) - Direct index access without hashing.

parameterdescription.para: The type of component to retrieve. cv-qualifiers are stripped.

simplesect.para: Pointer to the component if found, nullptr otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Retrieves a component by its runtime ComponentTypeId.

detaileddescription.para: Performs a direct array access using the provided type ID value. Useful when the component type is not known at compile time.
**Complexity:** O(1) - Direct index access.

parameterdescription.para: The runtime type ID of the component.

simplesect.para: Pointer to the component if found, nullptr otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Checks if a component with the given type ID exists.

detaileddescription.para: Performs bounds checking and nullptr verification.
**Complexity:** O(1) - Bounds check + nullptr comparison.

parameterdescription.para: The runtime type ID of the component to check.

simplesect.para: True if a component with this type ID exists, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Checks if the GameObject has a component of type T.

detaileddescription.para: Delegates to `has(ComponentTypeId)` using the compile-time type ID.
**Complexity:** O(1) - Direct index bounds check + nullptr comparison.

parameterdescription.para: The type of component to check for. cv-qualifiers are stripped.

simplesect.para: True if the component exists, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Checks if the GameObject has a component of type T and returns true if this component is enabled.

parameterdescription.para: The type of component to check for existence and if it's enabled.

simplesect.para: true if the component exists and is enabled, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Checks if the GameObject has a component of type T and returns true if this component is disabled.

parameterdescription.para: The type of component to check for existence and if it's disabled.

simplesect.para: true if the component exists and is disabled, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Returns the unique identifier for this GameObject.

simplesect.para: Const reference to the Guid, valid for the lifetime of this object.

briefdescription.para: Checks if this GameObject is currently active.

simplesect.para: True if the GameObject is active, false otherwise.
Inactive GameObjects are typically skipped during updates and rendering.

briefdescription.para: Returns a span over all attached (non-null) components.

detaileddescription.para: Provides access to a cached, filtered view of components. The cache is lazily rebuilt when components are added or removed.
**Complexity:** O(1) if cache is valid, O(n) on first call after modification.

simplesect.para: Span of non-null component pointers for mutable access.
Modifying the underlying vector bypasses lifecycle callbacks. Use `add()` for proper component management.

briefdescription.para: Returns a const span over all attached (non-null) components.

detaileddescription.para: Provides read-only access to a cached, filtered view of components.
**Complexity:** O(1) if cache is valid, O(n) on first call after modification.

simplesect.para: Span of non-null component pointers for const access.

briefdescription.para: Sets the active state of this GameObject.

detaileddescription.para:
When the active state changes, this method notifies all attached components by calling onActivate() or onDeactivate() accordingly. If the new state equals the current state, no action is taken. (
add())
active
The new active state.

briefdescription.para: Called when this GameObject is acquired from a pool.

detaileddescription.para: Notifies all attached components by calling their `onAcquire()` method. Used by the pool system to reset or initialize component state before reuse.

simplesect.para: GameObjectPool

briefdescription.para: Called when this GameObject is released back to a pool.

detaileddescription.para: Notifies all attached components by calling their `onRelease()` method. Used by the pool system to clean up component state before pooling.

simplesect.para: GameObjectPool

briefdescription.para: Finalizes attachment of components by calling lifecycle callbacks.

detaileddescription.para: If a specific component is passed, only that component is finalized. Otherwise, all unattached components are finalized. Calls `onAttach()` followed by `onActivate()` or `onDeactivate()` based on the GameObject's active state.

parameterdescription.para: Optional pointer to a specific component to finalize. If nullptr, all components are processed.

briefdescription.para: Base class for interactive game entities with component-based composition.

detaileddescription.para: GameObject serves as the fundamental building block for all interactive entities in the helios engine. It provides a type-indexed component storage system that enables O(1) component access and modification.

**Component Storage Architecture:** Components are stored in a vector indexed by `ComponentTypeId`. Each component type receives a unique compile-time ID, which determines its position in the storage vector. This approach trades memory (sparse vector with nullptr slots) for speed (direct indexing without hashing).

**Lifecycle Management:** The GameObject manages component lifecycles through callbacks:
`onAttach()` - Called when a component is added.
`onActivate()` / `onDeactivate()` - Called when the GameObject's active state changes.
`onAcquire()` / `onRelease()` - Called during pool-based lifecycle management.

**Storage Model:** Components are stored in a `std::vector<std::unique_ptr<Component>>` where the index corresponds to the component's `ComponentTypeId::value()`. The vector is resized on demand when new component types are added. Slots for component types that are not attached to this GameObject remain nullptr.

**Performance Characteristics:**
`get<T>()`: O(1) - Direct array access via type ID.
`has<T>()`: O(1) - Bounds check + nullptr check.
`add<T>()`: O(1) amortized - May trigger resize if type ID exceeds current capacity.
`components()`: O(n) on first call after modification (cache rebuild), O(1) thereafter.

simplesect.para: GameWorld
GameObjectPool
